alert.note: Alert for Broward (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 16 at 6:01PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Florida, including the following county, Broward. * WHEN...Until 730 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 559 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated that the thunderstorm has dissipated. However, light to moderate rains are still occurring over the area. Rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches has fall over this area through out the afternoon and additional rainfall up to 1 inch is possible with the heaviest rains. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. Therefore, the Flood Advisory remains in effect until 730 PM EDT this evening. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pompano Beach, Deerfield Beach, Lighthouse Point, Coconut Creek, Hillsboro Beach, Boca Pointe, North Pompano Beach and Pompano Beach Airport. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
